item.title: Just Logged Into RSC
item.dc:creator: @inspectah inspectah
item.description:
@inspectah wrote:

Haha, oh how i wish i’d have replied sooner.

Ok to start with if it wasn’t for RSC there would be no RS2. I would put everything i own on the line when i say, if RSC was reopened then RS2 would suffer greatly. The amount of nostalgia RSC has compared to RS2 is simply mind blowing. How you can call me stupid for stating true,legitimate facts which can be proved by digging around any forum linked with the never ending dream of players wanting RSC to come back, is pretty retarded. However, when RSC closed and hundreds if not thousands of players were no longer able to play it, then people had no choice but to play RS2 just to be able to say they can still play some form of the game.
RS2 was the booby prize to so many people. It was either play RS2 or find another game. You are more than entitled to an opinion on RSC, the fact remains that RSC is and always will be most nostalgic version of Runescape.

To touch upon what Rodgerwilco said about the methods involved in RSC, 2H/kite and ammy switching for staking… REAL pking. Unless you witnessed this on RSC at its peak, then i do not blame you for siding with RS2.

It’s like with movies, the sequels never quite live up to the expectations of the original version. ‘Runescape Classic’ Vs Runescape 2 (oldschool). You cant fudge with a Classic idc what anyone says.

Read full topic

Oh boy, since all support for RSC was dropped (no more quests, bot bans, fixes etc…) at the release of RS2 you were kinda forced move on or just don’t play at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Just Logged Into RSC
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Sigh. I know what you’re talking about with muscle memory and the 10,000 hour rule but it’s not how you play the game or your reaction time. It’s how you read the game and know how the game works. In relation to RSC it was extremely difficult to pk compared to runescape 2 and 3 because in our eyes the way the engine was setup allowed for it to be more competitive. You won’t see amulet switching, shield <-> 2h switch and the way you setup account meant a lot more. Pking required you to spend a shit ton of time making your character a certain way. I believe they got rid of plate pures and the wine system in rs2.

So back to the the spending time on a game / higher IQ will win. Let’s debate with a few basic games like Pong, Tetris, Snake etc etc. Since all of the current games today are just a complex version of the early games we played back in the 80s. All of the games require math skill and if you’re tossed something you don’t like (such as pac man ghosts moving) you’re required to problem solve the situation and this is where the higher IQ will come into play. The ability to understand how it works and generate a solution proves my point. In which the muscle memory and reaction timing will help you but it doesn’t find a solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Just Logged Into RSC
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

It’s typical for RSC gamers to be better than players affiliated with RS2.

Uhm, okay… Playing a game is like doing a sport for the first time. At first, you will suck. But as you continue to practice and get used to it and the rules of it, the better you become. Practice makes perfect. Yeah, a person with a higher IQ will have an advantage over people with lower IQ’s, but will your muscles?

Read full topic
